intro: Godetia epilobioides, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, orange to yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Godetia epilobioides is known for its ability to self-seed and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields.
